verses.roman:
rātri-divase kṛṣṇa-viraha-sphuraṇa
unmādera ceṣṭā kare pralāpa-vacana

synonyms: rātri-divase—day and night; kṛṣṇa-viraha—feelings of separation from Kṛṣṇa; sphuraṇa—awakening; unmādera—of a madman; ceṣṭā—activities; kare—performs; pralāpa—talking inconsistently; vacana—words.
translation: Day and night Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu felt separation from Kṛṣṇa. Manifesting symptoms of this separation, He cried and talked very inconsistently, like a madman.
